work.cod_n: possible duplicate incident in data note

data.name: Mansvelt Expedition
data.desc: Capt Edward Mansfield or Mansvelt re-captures Prov
data.agents_sp: Estevan de Ocampo, Juan de Somovilla Tejada, Joseph Ramírez de Leyva 104 men
data.agents_nsp0: Gov Thomas Modyford, Capt Edward Mansvelt 15 vessels 500 men
data.prim_n: SANTA_FE,L.223 [Perez a SM a 23 jun 1666 / Esteban a Matias a 14 jun 1666 / Junta a SM a 12 nov 1666 / Arlington a 4 ene 1667 / Decreto a 11 ene 1667 / Cédula a 6 ene 1667 / Testimonio a 22 jul 1666 / Relación de la restauración ... sf] / Exquemeling [missg]
data.note:
See 1666 Prov map in AGI, MP-PANAMA,77 /v Genkins 136 /
 22 Feb 1666 Council of Jam 'resolved that it is to the interest of the island to have letters of marque granted agains the Spaniard. 1. Because it furnishes the island with many necessary commodities at easy rates...with coin, bullion, cocoa, logwood, hides, tallow, indigo, cochineal, and many other commodities' /[missg] CSPC 5 /v Botella-Ordinas 144 /
 Summer 1667 Prov. Cartagena force retakes Prov; 3 slaves inform arriving force privateers present ≤ 100, w meagre defences; most privateers allowed to flee /v Genkins 139-140 /SANTA_FE,L.223 /
 Dec 1670 Prov. Capt Henry Morgan captures Prov without battle, though with a staged skirmish, en route to Panama /v Genkins 141 /Exquemeling [missg] /SANTA_FE,L.223 [Ramírez a SM a 13 oct 1671 / Salazar a 8 jul 1672] / Capt Morgan fleet for Panama = 36 Ships 1,846 men inc a French vessel, Saint-Jean [= 80 tonnes 10 guns 80 men], Capt Diego el Mulato /CO 138/1 f 105 /v Marley P 1 432 [doc no 8] /
 29 Jun 1665 Granada [Nicaragua, upstream of San Juan R] Morris and Martien sack Granada / 8 Apr 1666 Costa Rica. Mansfield [w sev hundred men, 7 Eng buccaneer ships, 5 lesser vessels, 2 prizes] leads unsuccessful invasion of Costa Rica /v Marley P 1 443 /
 Mansfield force given as 2 Frigs 3 Sloops > 100 Eng + 80 Fr in Marley P 1 443 /
 Possibly see 1666 Golfo Dulce. Fort of San Felipe de Lara attacked by pirates /v Zamora 178
